headline: REPORT: House GOP pushes Wray for transparency on FBI misconduct after audit report
author: DML News App
sentences:
Promoted Content
The FBI conducted an internal audit, a highly redacted version of which came to light earlier this month, that found 747 “compliance errors” across 353 separate cases in the category of “sensitive investigative matters.” The bureau acknowledged the 2019 audit findings were “unacceptable.”
The article goes on to state the following:
While the FBI has faced increased scrutiny in recent years for alleged politicized investigations into former President Donald Trump, the problems apparently are much broader and likely go beyond the report, said Biggs, a member of the House Judiciary Committee.

As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by Fox News:
Rep. Andy Biggs, R-Ariz., contends Democrats have a stake in digging for more details about the FBI breaking its own rules to probe elected officials, political candidates, religious organizations and the news media.

I suspect this conduct goes back for multiple administrations and has been an ongoing problem affecting members of both parties.”
Promoted Content
The House Judiciary Committee’s ranking member Rep. Jim Jordan, Rep. Mike Johnson, and Rep. Biggs all signed a letter to Christopher Wray demanding an unredacted copy of the audit.

Biggs told Fox News, “It possibly includes information about the surveillance of candidate Trump and later President Trump.

The next step is to call on the committee to have a hearing on this.
If I was in the majority, I would want to get to the bottom of this.
Biggs said there has been no response to the letter as of Thursday.

But this is almost 750 compliance problems in 350 cases.
